issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://demoui.asus.com/index.asp](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdemoui.asus.com%2Findex.asp) ### Comment > the apply buttons to validate forms throughout the webUI aren't working at all. Nothing happens except a console error. > This is happening on all Asus routers' WRT WebUI. this is a demo url of the webui but it happens also on my personal asus router on the DDNS https://MY-USERNAME.asuscomm.com. > And other owners of Asus routers could have set their webUI behind ANY personal or DDNS domain Username: `@paulverbeke` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/10b4nvs9l5us40og4kwkgk88woko40c3smrcvi5uam.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/4veb409qkvc4cwkgwcwkss0ogc4osk08piqctvt5x4.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- Platform: | uBlock Origin with "AdGuard French" list System version: | Windows 11, version 24H2 Browser: | Firefox Filters: | Language-specific:
AdGuard French

comment.body:
related to #145593

`@@||asus.com/popup.js` works well for the demo UI, but not for my router because the rule is too specific.
For example my router is accessible on Asus DDNS https://my-username.asuscomm.com but also on my own domain https://my-domain.com, both triggering the filter.

I suggest `@@||asuscomm.com/popup.js` for the DDNS. But for the custom domains I don't see an obvious workaround despite completely removing this rule

issue.title: Как с помощью фильтра изменить значение атрибута у html-тега ?
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [ ] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [ ] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

3.6.11/54

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://example.com

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, EasyList

### Privacy

AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, Adblock Warning Removal List, Fanboy's Annoyances, I don't care about cookies

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Как с помощью фильтра изменить значение атрибута у html-тега ?

Как в данном случае заменить 123 на 456 ?

```

<html abc="123" >

```

Вариант с простой replace - заменой текста отпадает. Страница рендерится "на лету".

p.s. Что промаркировать в опциях тикета стелс-режима при "высоком" уровне антитрекинга ?

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
